CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 3, 1957, pg. A1 reads: "Cooling Off - During a recent hot day, Courier photographer Charles (Teenie) Harris took a picture of these youngsters cooling off in 2200 block of Bedford Ave. They came out from under the refreshing spray of water only long enough to identify themselves as Carolyn and Donna Clark and Linda, Dianne and Marshall Neason."
TitMainTitle: Carolyn Clark, Donna Clark, Linda Dianne Neason, and Marshall Neason playing with hose while cleaning light colored Mercury car, in front of Bedford Ave. Cut - Rate store, 2212 Bedford Avenue, Hill District
